title: Mirror matches in Norms
body: Yea, it's really embarrassing. I'm a Gold 3 player playing norms as Riven v Riven. My opponent is bronze elo and i loose to him. I am a Gold 3 Riven main, loosing to a Bronze Riven main 0_0. I can't mirror match for shit in norms. idk if it's because mirrors don't exist in ranked so idk how to play it but if i could get tips on like wtf i should do, that be great. {{champion:92}}

replies.body: My suggestion would be to stop manning Riven. :^)

^

Main urgot,get mirrored once out of 400 games

I find that if I'm playing a mirror match, if I have an underdog mentality (expecting my opponent to outplay me/be better) then I do a lot better. It makes you think harder, play more cautiously, and be in a better position to recognise enemy mistakes - rather than just charging in and making your own mistakes. Just something to think about :p Mirror matches are the best way to see where you're at with a champ

Let me put it this way, mirror match ups basically incentivise that both players go ham on each other because their power spikes at each level are the same. That the only difference between the two is A) their creep score and information of what's going on.
